result.execSummary:
The defendant Ben M Trauger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).
  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent and concurrent to 12 month jail sentence in 16CF91.  Court authorizes transfer of probation to Outagamie County.

miscConds.notes:
No use or possession of controlled substances, unless prescribed by a physician.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No possession or consumption of intoxicants.
No association with known drug dealers.

Complete compas assessment,  counseling, evaluations, programs and assessments as appropriate and followup.
Pay supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections and follow rules of supervision.
Maintain absolute sobriety.

PSI WAIVED

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by calling the Work Release Unit  at 920-232-1915 or 920-232-1919 WITHIN 72 HOURS OF SENTENCING to set up an appointment.   The Work Release Units hours are 8:00 am-4:00 pm/Monday thru Friday. Defendant shall provide proof of identification along with the court minutes stating a DNA sample is required.  Failure to comply with this order may result in either a finding of contempt of court or a criminal charge of Failure to Provide a DNA Sample pursuant to Wis. Stats. 946.52.
Undertake AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations.
BOND APPLIED - COSTS PAID IN FULL - BALANCE OF $264 APPLIED TO COSTS IN 16CF91

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes: On each count concurrent but consecutive to any other sentence - with good time.  Huber granted, if in compliance with jail facility regulations.  Defendant currently in custody at the Fond du Lac County Jail.  Court authorizes transfer to Outagamie County.
